clinical_study.brief_title: A Dosing and Efficacy Study of Intra-nasal Sufentanil for Moderate to Severe Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Pain Control and Patient Satisfaction: a Dosing Study to Determine a Safe and Effective Dose of Intra-nasal Sufentanil to Treat Emergency Department Patients With Moderate to Severe Pain Due to Extremity Trauma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the appropriate dose and effectiveness of intra-nasal administration of a potent narcotic, sufentanil, for the treatment of moderate to severe pain due to broken bone(s) in the arm or leg.

intervention.description: Intra-nasal delivery, dosing range 0.5-1.0 mcg/kg, administered once at the beginning of the 30 minute study period

facility.name: University of Utah Health Sciences Center

clinical_study.keyword: Acute pain control with an intranasal opiate
